intro: Pelea oblanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pelea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Pelea oblanceolata is often found growing in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
